snippet: In the 1940s, R. Buckminster Fuller converted grain bins into emergency housing. For a long time it seemed they had disappeared from the earth, but at least a dozen have survived in New Jersey.
abstract: Camp Evans, decommissioned Army base in Wall Township, NJ, is home to last surviving examples of Dymaxion Deployment Units that R Buckminster Fuller designed as answer to World War II era housing needs; cylindrical corrugated metal housing units with conical roofs were created by converting metal grain bins.
lead_paragraph: In the 1940s, R. Buckminster Fuller converted grain bins into emergency housing. For a long time it seemed they had disappeared from the earth, but at least a dozen have survived in New Jersey.

headline.main: War Shelters, Short-Lived Yet Living On
headline.print_headline: War Shelters, Short-Lived Yet Living On
